channel.title: Using the moaprscape v3.2 webclient for a personal client
channel.description: I heard somewhere that you can change the Moparscape web client to automatically dial in a server address and an IP address. I tried editing the page's html code for the IP and port number but the clients security feature kicked in (thanks btw Mr. mopar, scared the hell outa me). I was hoping I could do this instead of going through the trouble of making my own web client. Thanks in advance and i apologize for my noobiness.

item.title: Using the moaprscape v3.2 webclient for a personal client
item.dc:creator: @masta_XY masta XY
item.description:
@masta_XY wrote:

hamster40:

Allright, is there a good tutorial you could point me to, i can’t find any good ones using search.

In the client section there is one.

Read full topic

item.title: Using the moaprscape v3.2 webclient for a personal client
item.dc:creator: @masta_XY masta XY
item.description:
@masta_XY wrote:

hamster40:

Hahaha i think Mr mopar might have a stalker :|, Anyways, thank you master, I was thinking of altering the actual address of the client “http://www.moparisthebest.com/index.php:5555:my server IP:” like that. But if that’s not possible, what is the next easiest way to make a web client?

Web client’s are probably the hardest to make… You need to jar, and sign the files… I would say leave the cache folder in there so it’s preloaded and will load the cache directly from the jarred file instead of downloading it… But it’s all up to you.

Read full topic

item.title: Using the moaprscape v3.2 webclient for a personal client
item.dc:creator: @masta_XY masta XY
item.description:
@masta_XY wrote:

Jeremy368:

Whos is Mr.Mopar… you got me interested…

Moparisthebest.

Also in addition to your question Hamster, no you cannot, since it is not your client, files you cannot change it to stay like that, it would cause the whole client to make everyone go on that one ip.

Read full topic
